title: Lee's kit has more base damage and scaling than assassins
body:
Lee's QQER: 1140 + 480% AD + 8% missing HP

Zed's RWQE, considering 50% damage amplification, 2 shrunken hits and passive:  948 + 415% AD + 9-15% max HP

Talon's EQWR, considering 15% damage amplification: 1035 + 460% AD

That's right. Lee's THREE damaging abilities outperform Zed's FIVE abilities and Talon's FOUR. He also gets a free escape on his fourth ability. Remind me again why is he allowed to do this kind of damage with all the utility he has?

No, he won't out damage late game Zed or Talon unless he builds full AD. But if he gets ahead he's impossible to outduel or escape. If he is behind in levels and gold he still wins fights because of how absurdly high his numbers are. Because shutting him down early to have him out damage you in addition to having better utility while 2 levels and 500 gold behind is totally fair and balanced.

Because seriously. Facing this overloaded piece  of shit is beyond frustrating. He is in every fucking game. Because there is no reason not to pick someone who does assassin-grade damage with support-level utility.

That was my point. With all the utility he brings Lee absolutely shouldn't do comparable damage as assassins. Assassin's job is, well... assassinating by dealing extremely high and fast single target damage. If we have a generalist with no real weakness doing assassin level damage - well, we have a problem.

Sure, you won't see Lee build full assassin. But with that he will assassinate people early game. He will be impossible to outduel if you are even with him, and impossible to outrun because of his kit. He will be able to outdamage you even when behind. Lee is extremely hard to shut down due to his broken mobility and CC, and even if you manage to you won't be properly rewarded since his insane bases and scalings will allow him to stand head-to-head with you even when behind in gold and levels.

Why would you build AD when you can build tanky and still destroy everyone with your high base damages? :^)

Tanks go straight into a fight, have natural survivability, sustained damage patterns, team utility/CC and are usually not attractive targets to try and take down if you've got any better options. Assassins by contrast tend to flank, have extremely high target selection and burst, low team utility, lack constant survivability (instead relying on other tools like mobility, untargetability, stealth etc) and are usually great targets to kill if you can focus them. Combining those two categories risks creating very tanky, mobile champions with high CC/utility that set up their own kills, are extremely hard to take down and will happily chew through an entire team. When that goes wrong you get things like release Xin Zhao. When balanced you get a character that's ok at a lot of things, lacks clear strengths or weaknesses and isn't well distinguished from other similar champions (the fighter problem basically).
